comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: This building, also known as Palazzo Corpi, housed U.S. diplomatic missions from 1882 to 2003, when the embassy was moved to a new building for security reasons. The addition on the back, known as the Chancery, was built in 1910. A comprehensive history of the building, which discusses how it became "the first and only U.S. diplomatic premises to be won in a poker game", can be found at istanbul.usconsulate.gov/history2.html . Apparently, it is now being redeveloped into a hotel: llenrock.com/blog/istanbul-not-constantinople/

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Perhaps in the news stream at this point because of the return in February, 1916 of U.S. Ambassador to the Ottoman Empire, Henry Morgenthau, Sr.
